intro: Petrogenia, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants in the mustard family, Brassicaceae. These plants are typically found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. They produce small, delicate flowers that are often white or yellow, and their leaves are usually narrow and succulent. Petrogenia species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in poor soils. The genus includes several species, some of which are native to North America and other parts of the world.
